intro: Tricuspidaria patagua, commonly known as the Patagonian tricuspid, is a rare flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive three-lobed leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with deep roots that help it access groundwater. Its botanical features make it an important subject for studies on plant adaptation and conservation in extreme climates. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires protection.
